metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1544 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the CERT_DestroyCertificate function in libnss3.so in Mozilla Network Security Services (NSS) 3.x, as used in Firefox before 31.0, Firefox ESR 24.x before 24.7, and Thunderbird before 24.7, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via vectors that trigger certain improper removal of an NSSCertificate structure from a trust domain.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1544` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 31.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 31.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 31.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 31.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

libnss3 - 2:3.15.4-1ubuntu7.1
libnss3-1d - 2:3.15.4-1ubuntu7.1
libnss3-nssdb - 2:3.15.4-1ubuntu7.1
libnss3-tools - 2:3.15.4-1ubuntu7.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:31.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:31.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:31.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:31.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:31.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:31.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:31.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:31.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '31.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
nss package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.15.4-1ubuntu7.1').
thunderbird package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:31.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
